intro: Gnaphalium albatum, commonly known as the albatross weed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish to white flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are clustered in small inflorescences. Gnaphalium albatum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
